description: Hope, based on expectations of opportunity, and fear, grounded in cataclysms, shape everyday
life and the United States' role in the world. Fears underlie conflicts between groups; hope
animates social movements and energizes human rights initiatives. This course prepares students
to be engaged citizens on campus and beyond. A culminating civic engagement experience
draws from previous American Conversations assignments. Students will help design part of the
course, shaping future conversations of hope and fear. Offered annually in the spring semester.
